root.para: For items valued by the entity using a valuation model, the auditor does not function as an appraiser. Rather, the auditor reviews the model and evaluates whether the assumptions used are reasonable, and the model is appropriate, considering the entityâ€™s circumstances. For example, it may be inappropriate to use discounted cash flows for valuing an equity investment in a start-up enterprise if no current revenues exist on which to base the forecast of future earnings or cash flows.
